abstract: Study in journal Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences reports cytomegalovirus, infection transmitted from mother to fetus in pregnancy and often resulting in neurological impairment, has been found in rhesus monkeys; discovery marks first time virus has been found in nonhuman primate.
lead_paragraph: The first nonhuman finding of cytomegalovirus could help scientists develop a vaccine to protect against the infection.

headline.main: Serious Human In Utero Infection Is Found in Rhesus Monkeys
headline.print_headline: Primates: A Human Fetal Infection Hits Rhesus Monkeys

snippet: The first nonhuman finding of cytomegalovirus could help scientists develop a vaccine to protect against the infection.
